newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thailand to approve new mobile phones next month.
newsitem.headline: Thailand to approve new mobile phones next month.

text.p: Thailand's transport and communication ministry will seek cabinet approval next month for a proposal to allow new mobile phone operators to enter the market, a senior official said on Tuesday.
"The ministry is expected to propose the plan to the cabinet next month," Direk Charoenpol, deputy transport and communications minister, told reporters.
Direk said the proposal was part of the government's policy to liberalise the local mobile phone and telecommunications industry.
Thailand currently has two private mobile phone operators - Advanced Info Services Plc and Total Access Communication Plc.
The ministry plans to grant between four and five new mobile phone licences to private companies, he said.
